alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 9:59AM EST until February 25 at 2:43AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale affecting Martin and Lawrence Counties. .A combination of snow melt and rainfall from Wednesday night through Thursday with 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain falling on saturated ground. This has led to widespread flooding across central Indiana with many smaller streams and rivers either in flood or nearing flood stage. Flooding along the main stem rivers will continue through the weekend and into early next week. Another series of rain events are possible next week which would prolong and potentially exacerbate ongoing flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, A few local county roads begin to flood and are impassable. These include Buddha Road south of the gage and Lawrenceport Road. All local roads across the East Fork White River are threatened by high water, and some are closed. Flooding of agricultural lands in Lawrence County is in progress. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 23.4 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1000 PM EST.
